maml:description.maml:para: Locate an IP network.
Gets geolocation data of an IP's network. You can provide up to 10 IPs as a comma-separated string.
IP address(es) you want to get the data for.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
IP address(es) you want to get the data for.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get the connectivity problems scenario response.

Gets the status of the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsConnectivityProblem` operation. Operations with the `executionStatus` of `SUCCESS ` include also additional details, such as the fetched GREP, cURL, and MTR data.
Unique identifier for a request. To get this value, run the corresponding POST operation.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Includes response bodies in the response.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Includes response bodies in the response.
Unique identifier for a request. To get this value, run the corresponding POST operation.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get the content problems scenario response.
Gets the status of the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsContentProblem` operation. Operations with the `executionStatus` of `SUCCESS ` include also additional details, such as the GREP and cURL data.
Unique identifier for a request. To get this value, run the corresponding POST operation.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

PowerShell will not allow a PSCustomObject to have keys with the same value and differ only by casing, so this function will remove known conflicting keys from the response to accomodate. If you would rather a HashTable (which does support keys that differ only in casing) provide this option.
Includes response bodies in the response.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

PowerShell will not allow a PSCustomObject to have keys with the same value and differ only by casing, so this function will remove known conflicting keys from the response to accomodate. If you would rather a HashTable (which does support keys that differ only in casing) provide this option.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Includes response bodies in the response.
Unique identifier for a request. To get this value, run the corresponding POST operation.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get error statistics.

Gets the HTTP status codes distribution statistics from delivering a URL or CP code based on the nine-second traffic sample from the last two minutes. You can filter the results by `-Delivery` and `-ErrorType`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
CP code you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or URL.

Type of network you want to get traffic data for, either `STANDARD_TLS` or `ENHANCED_TLS`. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics checks on its own the type of delivery used by the requested CP code or URL and returns data for it. If it uses both types, then Edge Diagnostics returns data for the type which got all data collected faster. If you choose the delivery type not used by your resource, then the results are empty.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Type of traffic direction you want to get the data for, either `EDGE_ERRORS` or `ORIGIN_ERRORS`. The `EDGE_ERRORS` value returns data for the edge server response to a client and `ORIGIN_ERRORS` for the edge server forward request to an origin server. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics returns data for both.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Type of network you want to get traffic data for, either `STANDARD_TLS` or `ENHANCED_TLS`. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics checks on its own the type of delivery used by the requested CP code or URL and returns data for it. If it uses both types, then Edge Diagnostics returns data for the type which got all data collected faster. If you choose the delivery type not used by your resource, then the results are empty.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Type of traffic direction you want to get the data for, either `EDGE_ERRORS` or `ORIGIN_ERRORS`. The `EDGE_ERRORS` value returns data for the edge server response to a client and `ORIGIN_ERRORS` for the edge server forward request to an origin server. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics returns data for both.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or CPCode.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
CP code you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or URL.

Type of network you want to get traffic data for, either `STANDARD_TLS` or `ENHANCED_TLS`. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics checks on its own the type of delivery used by the requested CP code or URL and returns data for it. If it uses both types, then Edge Diagnostics returns data for the type which got all data collected faster. If you choose the delivery type not used by your resource, then the results are empty.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Type of traffic direction you want to get the data for, either `EDGE_ERRORS` or `ORIGIN_ERRORS`. The `EDGE_ERRORS` value returns data for the edge server response to a client and `ORIGIN_ERRORS` for the edge server forward request to an origin server. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics returns data for both.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or CPCode.
Get a translate error string response.

Gets the status of the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsErrorTranslation` operation. Operations with the `executionStatus` of `SUCCESS` include also details about the error. For operations in progress, the returned object contains `retryAfter` and `requestId`. In this case, wait for the duration of the `retryAfter` interval, then run this operation again.
Unique identifier for a request. To get this value, run the corresponding POST operation.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Get diagnostic data for an end-user group.
Gets collected diagnostic data for a specific group. You can also request additional cURL, DIG, and MTR data. To retrieve the group ID, run the `Get-Group` operation.
Unique identifier for a group.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Includes MTR results in the response.

Get GTM properties.

Gets the GTM properties you have access to. You can use the returned `hostname` values to run the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsMTR` and `New-EdgeDiagnosticsDig` operations for a GTM hostname. Note that the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsMTR` operation also requires hostname's test and target IP values that you can get by running the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGTMPropertyIPs` operation.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get test and target IPs for a GTM hostname.

Gets test and target IPs for a GTM property. You can use the returned data to run the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsMTR` operation for a GTM hostname. To get the data necessary for this request, run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGTMProperties` operation first.
Domain of the GTM property.
Name of the GTM property.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Get IP acceleration hostnames.
Gets IP acceleration (IPA) hostnames you have access to and can run the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsLink` operation to collect diagnostic data.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Get available edge server locations.

Gets active edge server locations. Use the `id` values from this operation in the `-EdgeLocationId` parameter when you run `New-EdgeDiagnosticsCurl`, `New-EdgeDiagnosticsDig`, `New-EdgeDiagnosticsMTR`, `New-EdgeDiagnosticsURLHealthCheck`, `New-EdgeDiagnosticsConnectivityProblem`, or `New-EdgeDiagnosticsContentProblem` operation. To get a subset of edge servers supporting metadata tracer, run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsMetadataTraceLocations` operation.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get specific logs.

Using the GREP command, returns logs that match the parameters that you specify in your request. This operation retrieves the data directly. If you don't get detailed information about the logs or you want to avoid latency, run the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsGrep` operation.
IP address that belongs to edge server and you want to get the logs for.
CP code you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or URL.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Client IP to filter the logs by.
Object status codes you want to get the logs for.
HTTP status code to filter the logs by.
User agent to filter the logs by.
ARL to filter the logs by.

ISO 8601 timestamp for a point of time in the past when the log search window starts. You can get the logs from either the last 6 or 24 hours depending on the server and traffic conditions. The recommended 10-minute periods ensure that data fetches quickly and you get the most relevant logs.
ISO 8601 timestamp for a point of time in the past when the log search window ends.
Record type of the logs. Possible values are either `R` for client requests to an edge server or `F` for forward requests from an edge server to the origin.
ARL to filter the logs by.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
CP code you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or URL.
Client IP to filter the logs by.
IP address that belongs to edge server and you want to get the logs for.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
ISO 8601 timestamp for a point of time in the past when the log search window ends.
HTTP status code to filter the logs by.
Record type of the logs. Possible values are either `R` for client requests to an edge server or `F` for forward requests from an edge server to the origin.
Object status codes you want to get the logs for.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

ISO 8601 timestamp for a point of time in the past when the log search window starts. You can get the logs from either the last 6 or 24 hours depending on the server and traffic conditions. The recommended 10-minute periods ensure that data fetches quickly and you get the most relevant logs.
User agent to filter the logs by.
Check a metadata tracing request status.

Gets the status of the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsMetadataTrace` operation. Operations with the `executionStatus` of `SUCCESS` include also the metadata details. For requests with the added `-HTMLFormat` switch parameter, results are in static HTML format.
Unique identifier for a request. To get this value, run the corresponding POST operation.

Return metadata trace in HTML format.

Get available edge server locations for metadata tracing.

Gets active locations. Use the `id` values from this operation in the `-MtLocationId` parameter when you run the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsMetadataTrace` operation together with information about supported HTTP methods. The operation responds with a subset of edge servers returned by the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsLocations` operation.

Translate an Akamaized URL.

Provides basic information about a specific hostname or domain name, such as typecode, origin server, CP code, serial number, and TTL. A URL becomes an Akamaized URL (ARL) once it's on an edge server.
Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or CPCode.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Run the connectivity problems scenario.

Launches an asynchronous request to run in parallel the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsGrep` and `New-EdgeDiagnosticsCurl` operations for a URL. Use the response results to diagnose issues with slow download and high response time. Operations with the `executionStatus` of `SUCCESS` return the fetched GREP and cURL data.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Client IP to filter the logs by.
Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to end users experiencing issues with the URL.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
IP version for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run cURL and MTR commands, either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.
Packet type for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.
Port number for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`.
Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes Akamai Pragma headers by default.
Runs Connectivity problems from a Site Shield map.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request.
IP of the edge server you want to serve traffic from.
Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or CPCode.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.

Port number for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`.
Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes Akamai Pragma headers by default.
Runs Connectivity problems from a Site Shield map.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request.

Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or CPCode.

Request content with cURL.

Requests content using the cURL command to provide the raw HTML for a URL, including request headers. You can run this operation for a specific location, an edge server IP, or a Site Shield map. To get the data for a location, you need to run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsLocations` operation first to get the `edgeLocationId`. To run this operation for an IP, you need to run the `Test-EdgeDiagnosticsIP` operation to verify if it belongs to an edge server. If you don't provide a location or an edge server IP, then Edge Diagnostics runs the operation using a random edge server IP.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Get domain details with DIG.

Using the DIG command, provides DNS details for the location of an edge server, a hostname, a domain name, or a GTM hostname. The results can help you diagnose issues with the domain name resolutions. You can run this operation either for a specific location or an edge server IP. To get the data for a location, you need to run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsLocations operation` first to get the `edgeLocationId`. To run this operation for an IP, you need to run the `Test-EdgeDiagnosticsIP` operation to verify if it belongs to an edge server. To run this operation for a GTM hostname, you need to run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGTMProperties` operation first. If you don't provide a location ID or an edge server IP, then Edge Diagnostics runs the operation using a random edge server IP.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
IP address that belongs to edge server and you want to get the logs for.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Hostname or a domain name you want to get the data for. For a GTM hostname, run Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGTMProperties first, to get this value.
Specifies Hostname is a GTM hostname.

Translate error string.

Launches an asynchronous request to fetch a summary and logs for an error with a specific reference code. The error logs are from the last 6 or 24 hours depending on the server and traffic conditions. You can also translate any Global Request Number (GRN) generated by the Property Manager's `Global Request Number` behavior. For operations in progress, the returned object contains `retryAfter`, `requestId`, and `link`. In this case, wait for the duration of the `retryAfter` interval, then either use the `requestId` to run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsErrorTranslation` operation, or simply GET the `link`.
Alphanumeric part of the error reference code you want to get the data for.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Gets logs from all edge servers involved in serving the request. When false, you get logs only from the edge server where the error occurred. Tracing forward logs may prolong the time of fetching data.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Alphanumeric part of the error reference code you want to get the data for.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Gets logs from all edge servers involved in serving the request. When false, you get logs only from the edge server where the error occurred. Tracing forward logs may prolong the time of fetching data.

Gets a debugging report on the ESI code of your source page and all pages that the source page references.

Launch a GREP request.

Launches an asynchronous request to fetch logs for an edge server IP address using the GREP command. To verify if an IP belongs to an edge server, run the `Test-EdgeDiagnosticsIP` operation first. If you know the exact values to filter the logs by and you want to get the data directly, run the synchronous `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsLogs` operation.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Generate a diagnostic link.

Generates a diagnostic link for you to share with your users of a particular URL or IP acceleration hostname experiencing similar issues. After your user clicks the link, the tool gathers necessary diagnostic data and asks them to submit it. Once submitted, you can check the collected data with the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGroup` operation. Each link is valid for 7 days of 50 submissions. To get the list of IP acceleration hostnames for which you can collect diagnostic data, run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsIPAHostnames` operation first.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
IP acceleration hostname you want to collect the diagnostic data for. You need to provide either this value or `url`. To get the available hostnames, run Get-EdgeDiagnosticsIPAHostnames.
Notes about the group or issues experienced by group's end users.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or CPCode.
Launch a metadata tracing request.

Launches an asynchronous request to trace metadata for a URL configured in Property Manager. The metadata tracing works for the current property version active either on the staging or production network. To run the operation for a location, run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsMetadataTraceLocations` operation first to get the required values. If you don't provide a location ID or an edge server IP, then Edge Diagnostics runs the operation using a random location.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
IP address that belongs to edge server and you want to get the logs for.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
HTTP method you want to use to run the operation, either `HEAD`, `POST`, or the default `GET` method.
Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes Akamai Pragma headers by default.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request.
Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or CPCode.
Runs the request on the staging environment.

Test network connectivity with MTR.

Using MTR, provides information about packet loss and latency between an edge server IP and a location or between a Site Shield map and a remote destination. To run this operation for an IP, you need to run the `Test-EdgeDiagnosticsIP` operation first to verify if it belongs to an edge server. To run this operation for a GTM hostname, run the `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGTMProperties` and `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGTMPropertyIPs` operations first to get the test and target IPs for the hostname.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

MTR destination compliant with the `destinationType`, either a hostname or a destination IP. To build an object for a GTM hostname, enter the `target` value returned by the List test and target IPs for a GTM hostname (ref:get-gtm-property-domain-gtm-property-ips)operation. For a Site Shield hostname, enter a destination IP address.
Type of destination input, either `IP` or `HOST`. To build an object for a GTM or Site Shield hostname, choose `IP`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Packet type for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.
Port number for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`.
Resolves DNS for each hop.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Shows IPs for each hop.
Shows locations for each hop.
Site Shield hostname you want to run the MTR for.

MTR source compliant with the `sourceType`, either an edge server IP or a location. For locations, enter `edgeLocationId` for an edge server location closest to your end users. To get this value, run Get-EdgeDiagnosticsLocations first. For edge IPs, use the edge server IP value from the `answerSection` array in the New-EdgeDiagnosticsDig response. To build an object for a GTM hostname, enter the `testIp` value returned by Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGTMPropertyIPs.
Type of the source input, either `EDGE_IP` or `LOCATION`. To build an object for a GTM hostname, choose `EDGE_IP`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.

MTR destination compliant with the `destinationType`, either a hostname or a destination IP. To build an object for a GTM hostname, enter the `target` value returned by the List test and target IPs for a GTM hostname (ref:get-gtm-property-domain-gtm-property-ips)operation. For a Site Shield hostname, enter a destination IP address.
Type of destination input, either `IP` or `HOST`. To build an object for a GTM or Site Shield hostname, choose `IP`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Packet type for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.
Port number for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`.
Resolves DNS for each hop.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Shows IPs for each hop.
Shows locations for each hop.
Site Shield hostname you want to run the MTR for.

MTR source compliant with the `sourceType`, either an edge server IP or a location. For locations, enter `edgeLocationId` for an edge server location closest to your end users. To get this value, run Get-EdgeDiagnosticsLocations first. For edge IPs, use the edge server IP value from the `answerSection` array in the New-EdgeDiagnosticsDig response. To build an object for a GTM hostname, enter the `testIp` value returned by Get-EdgeDiagnosticsGTMPropertyIPs.
Type of the source input, either `EDGE_IP` or `LOCATION`. To build an object for a GTM hostname, choose `EDGE_IP`.
Run the URL health check.

Launches an asynchronous request to run in parallel the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsGrep`, `New-EdgeDiagnosticsDig`, `New-EdgeDiagnosticsCurl`, `New-EdgeDiagnosticsMTR`, and `Get-EdgeDiagnosticsURLTranslation` operations for a URL. Operations with the `executionStatus` of `SUCCESS` return the fetched GREP, DIG, cURL, and MTR data as well as Akamaized URL (ARL) (https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/arl-syntax)details.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to end users experiencing issues with the URL.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
IP version for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run cURL and MTR commands, either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.
Packet type for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.
Port number for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`.
DNS record type you want to get. Possible values are: `A`, `AAAA`, `SOA`, `CNAME`, `PTR`, `MX`, `NS`, `TXT`, `SRV`, `CAA`, or `ANY`.
Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes Akamai Pragma headers by default.
Runs Connectivity problems from a Site Shield map.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request.
IP of the edge server you want to serve traffic from.
Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or CPCode.

Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to end users experiencing issues with the URL.

Verify and locate an IP.

Verifies if an IP belongs to an edge server and gets the geolocation data of its network. For IPs verified positively, you can continue gathering diagnostic data with the `New-EdgeDiagnosticsCurl`, `New-EdgeDiagnosticsDig`, or `New-EdgeDiagnosticsMTR` operation. The `-IPAddress` parameter is a single IP or a comma-separated string of up to 10 IPs.
IP address(es) you want to get the data for.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Includes location information in the response.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
IP address(es) you want to get the data for.
Includes location information in the response.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
